title: The Best Last Of Us Merch - Figures, Graphic Novels, Board Games, Apparel, And More
description: The Last of Us Season Two premiers on HBO on April 13, continuing Joel and Ellie’s journey through a land ravaged by a fungal pandemic. In anticipation of the show's return, a selection of cool Last of Us merch is up for grabs, and we've rounded up our favorites into the list below. This includes action figures, art books, a board game, and the official Last of Us a prequel comic book. You’ll even find a selection of hoodies and T-shirts, giving you a fun way to update your wardrobe. It’s also a good time to dive back into the video games or check them out for the first time. The Last of Us: The Complete First Season Steelbook (4K)$38 ($50)Relive the first season of The Last of Us with this premium collection. Along with every episode, you’ll get over two hours of bonus features--including a look at how the show adapted the events of the games and other behind-the-scenes content. It also comes with a colorful (and frightening) steelbook, so you can show it off in your collection when not in use. See at Amazon The Last of Us Video GamesStill haven’t played the iconic video games? Now is a great time to dive in, with copies available on PS4, PS5, and PC.PS5The Last of Us Part 1 -- $52 ($70)The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered -- $50PS4The Last of Us Remastered -- $20The Last of Us Part 2 -- $40PCThe Last of Us Part 1 -- $60The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered -- $45 ($50) | Releases April 3 The Last of Us Limited Edition DualSense$85 | Releases April 10Preorders open for this gorgeous DualSense on March 14, and it’s bound to sell out fast. Featuring a bunch of easter eggs hidden throughout the gamepad and a stylish black and white design, it’s arguably one of the best-looking DualSense Controllers we’ve seen. Note that this is a standard DualSense, not the premium DualSense Edge. See more details Action Figures$40.20 ($50)The Joel and Ellie Action Figure 2-Pack is discounted right now. Along with over 30 points of articulation, the duo includes heaps of accessories (such as weapons and swappable hands). Consider picking them up if you want a fun way to decorate your game room or home theater. See at Amazon The Last of Us: Escape The Dark Board Game $71.51 ($75)Journey from the Quarantine Zone to Jackson in this cooperative board game. Thanks to a dynamic challenge system, you’ll encounter new obstacles each time you play--like encounters with FEDRA agents or the need to escape a horde of infected. Up to five players can join in on the action, and solo play is also supported. See at Amazon Tubbz The Last of Us Vinyl Rubber Duck FiguresLooking for a way to combine your love for rubber ducks and The Last of Us? You’re in luck--Tubbz offers a few hilarious vinyl rubber duck figures based on the hit video game. Ellie and Joel are the highlights, but here’s a look at everything currently available.See at Amazon:Ellie -- $20Joel -- $20Joel (Mini Edition) -- $9Bill -- $19.74 ($25)Tess -- $16.67 ($20)Bloater -- $30Clicker -- $30 Youtooz Last of Us Collectibles:A few cool collectibles are available from Youtooz, including two creepy versions of a Clicker and one featuring Joel with a crumbling city serving as the background. All three would make for excellent companions for your home office, with each standing about five inches tall.See at Amazon: Clicker -- $30 Clicker Illuminated -- $30 Joel -- $35 The Last of Us Art booksGo behind the scenes on the game's development with these premium art books. All three are hardcovers with around 200 pages of content--including concept art, commentary from the producers and artists, and more. The Art of the Last of Us Part 2 Deluxe Edition even comes with an exclusive cover and slipcase, plus a gallery-quality lithograph.See at Amazon:The Art of The Last of Us Part 2 Deluxe -- $63 ($90)The Art of the Last of Us Part 2 -- $29.70 ($50)The Art of The Last of Us -- $36 ($50) The Last of Us: American Dreams Prequel Comic $16.76 ($20)The Last of Us: American Dreams is a prequel comic set before the first game. It follows 13-year-old Ellie as she navigates life in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Along with a closer look at her life before meeting Joel, it also features concept art and behind-the-scenes sketches. This collection includes all four issues of American Dreams. See at Amazon The Last of Us Edition Paladone Home GoodsPaladone makes a few officially licensed home goods based on The Last of Us. This includes a mug with a design that changes when exposed to heat, a Firefly Light that makes a cool nightlight, and a glow in the dark water bottle.See at Amazon:Water Bottle -- $29.45Firefly Light -- $27Heat Change Mug -- $14 Official Last of Us Licensed Hoodies A whole bunch of officially licensed hoodies are up for grabs. These are available in a variety of sizes, colors, and designs, and there’s bound to be something that fits your style. See at Amazon Official Last of Us Licensed T-Shirts Many of the same hoodie designs are available as T-shirts. These are also much cheaper, typically costing around $20. See at Amazon The Last of Us Statues Created by Dark Horse, these statues are a premium way to decorate your space. Several models have sold out, but both the Dark Horse Store and Walmart have a few in stock--including figures for Joel, Ellie, and Abby. Standing about nine inches tall, they’re much more luxurious than the Joel & Ellie Action Figure 2-Pack. See at Walmart See at Dark Horse Store

title: The Mandalorian Armorer's Helmet Is Getting A Premium Black Series replica Mandalorian Helmet
description: Star Wars: The Black Series - Armorer Helmet Replica $100 | Releases April 12 Preorder at Amazon The next replica in Hasbro's Star Wars Black Series is the ornate helmet of The Armorer from Star Wars: The Mandalorian. Like other Black Series collectibles, the upcoming Armorer Helmar is great for Star Wars fans looking to expand their collection, or cosplayers seeking an authentic, affordable accessory. The Star Wars: The Black Series Armorer Helmet launches April 12, and preorders are available for $100 at Amazon. Star Wars: The Black Series - Armorer Helmet Replica $100 | Releases April 12 Billed as a roleplay item, this is an officially licensed 1-to-1 replica of the Armorer's helmet. It features a screen-accurate design, including realistic weathering that you'd expect to see on the mask of someone who spends all day forging battle armor. The interior is added and includes adjustable straps to help you find the best fit, as well as numerous details on the inner shell to make it look like it came straight out of the Star Wars galaxy. Preorder at Amazon This isn't the only collectible helmet that you can buy right now. If you're looking to complete your collection of Mandalorians, Hasbro has also released replica Din Djarin, Boba Fett, and Sabine Wren helmets--or if you feel like taking a walk on the dark side, you can assemble your own squad of the Empire's finest with the Stormtrooper, Scout Trooper, and Shadow Trooper helmets. There's even a neat Darth Vader replica available, perfect for any cosplayer looking to dress up as the iconic Sith Lord and not have to worry about risking damaging one of their other pricy replicas.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: What's Really Going on with Helly R. In This Week's Severance?
description: As we head into the Severance Season 2 finale, something's not quite right with Helly R. Is she actually Helena Eagan again, or is there something else going on with both sides of her personality?

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 870
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which would you rather have in your makeup collection: a nail polish that never chipped, a foundation that perfectly matched your skin tone, a long-lasting mascara that was easy to remove or a lipstick that never dried out your lips? Nail polish that never chipped! In a heartbeat. 2. How good are you at doing other people’s hair? Not great. Actually, terrible. I realized I really need to work at it when I tried to do Connor’s hair in a french braid for a dance competition, and it looked so wonky it was laughable. 3. What do you do when you’re sitting on a flight next to a stranger: chat them up or put in your headphones and pretend they’re not there? I’ll do a little polite[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 870 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 869
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which would you rather collect: vintage clothes or vintage furniture? I could do both, but if I could only pick one, I’d have to go with vintage clothes, mostly because I don’t have a big enough house to collect furniture pieces. Sigh! Oh, and also, I don’t want to worry about my furniture being beat up by the pets and the kids playing in my house, you know? 2. How good are you with keeping secrets? If you tell me something in confidence, it’s going to the grave with me, babe; however, I do have an exception policy. If I believe someone’s in danger, then I’m gonna say something. 3. Who’s the coolest Jennifer: Jennifer Hudson, Jennifer Lopez, Jennifer Garner or Jennifer Coolidge? Jennifer Coolidge, all the[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 869 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

description: Statistically, you probably haven’t seen the Monster Hunter movie, probably because it came out at exactly the wrong time. Paul W.S. Anderson’s adaptation of Capcom’s video game series was released in December 2020, during a period where many people were still staying home rather than going to the theaters. It’s one of the only box-office […]

title: Why Wheel of Time’s Josha Stradowski sees season 3 Rand as Mike Tyson
description: Rand al’Thor is a singular figure in the Wheel of Time series: Though there are other men who try their hand at channeling, Rand’s prophetic role as the Dragon Reborn means he’s the sole man who’s able to use magic effectively (or, at least, without eventually being driven mad).  That also puts Josha Stradowski, the […]
author: Zosha Millman

title: Dune: Awakening's new trailer details how its map changes every week, which sounds awful for cartographers
description: I get that in-world the whole appeal of Dune's Arrakis is all of that spice it harbours, but to be honest the giant sandworms are a bit of a dealbreaker for me. Even still, I have to admit that Dune: Awakening looks pretty neat even with that ever present threat, and a new trailer all about exploring the desert planet that dropped this week has helped pique my interest a little further. For starters, that desert bike looks pretty nifty, my time in Sable taught me that I love a good zoom through beautiful, sandy vistas, and this looks to be similar, even if Dune: Awakening's world is a bit more hostile. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Half-Life 2 RTX and all of its foggy, ray-traced lighting is getting a demo next week
description: Remember when Nvidia announced that Half-Life 2 RTX mod way back in, crikey, 2023? Yeah, I didn't realise how long it had been either. To be perfectly honest I thought it had already come out, but apparently not, because just this week Nvidia shared that Half-Life 2 RTX is getting a demo next week on March 18th. No, the full mod still doesn't have a release date, but when do any game projects ever release quickly after they were announced? Read more

title: Grand Theft Auto 5's PC RT enhancements hint at GTA 6 features
description: Grand Theft Auto 5 on PC has finally received the RT upgrades to achieve feature parity with the current generation console versions, almost three years since they arrived on Xbox and PlayStation consoles. The wait was worth it as scalability is impressive and the game also includes the ability to toggle ray traced global illumination - which may well hint at the kind of RT features we can expect to see in the upcoming Grand Theft Auto 6.
